subject: Sleep
title: The Sleep Industry Boom
description: One-minute skill: The Sleep Industry Boom.

hook.text: The global sleep industry is worth over 430 billion dollars. We're spending a fortune trying to buy better sleep.

buildup.text: Mattresses, trackers, supplements, apps, weighted blankets, and sleep retreats have exploded in the last decade.

discovery.text: The sleep economy grew as public awareness of sleep's health importance increased through bestselling books and media.

twist.text: Most sleep products have little scientific evidence behind them. The industry profits from anxiety about sleep.

climax.text: Ironically, worrying about optimizing sleep, called orthosomnia, can itself cause insomnia.

punchline.text: We commodified sleep and then lost sleep worrying about it.

quiz.question: What is orthosomnia?
options: Anxiety about optimizing sleep that itself causes insomnia
